elements.text:
1. The Adrenal Crash (Medical Emergency)
    [ ] Dizziness upon standing (room spins/goes black).
    [ ] Profound weakness (limbs feel heavy/can't lift head).
    [ ] Unexplained nausea or vomiting.
    [ ] Confusion or disorientation.

2. Withdrawal Aches (Body needs more time)
    [ ] Deep bone/joint pain (worse than original pain).
    [ ] Severe fatigue (sleep doesn't help).
    [ ] Freezing cold or low-grade fever/chills.

3. The Rebound (Inflammation returning)
    [ ] Original symptoms return aggressively.
    [ ] Itch, spasm, or pain comes back worse than before.

4. Mental/Emotional Crash
    [ ] Sudden depression or crying spells.
    [ ] Anxiety, racing heart, or sense of doom.
    [ ] Insomnia due to hormonal imbalance.

ACTION PLAN (If symptoms occur)
    Don't Drop: Stay on current dose for an extra 2–3 days.
    Step Back: If severe, go back to the previous higher dose.
    Hydrate & Salt: Drink electrolytes (Gatorade/broth) for dizziness.
    Emergency: If "Adrenal Crash" symptoms appear, seek medical help immediately.

[   ]  Day 1 - 40 mg - 8 tablets - Take all with breakfast.
[   ]  Day 2 - 40 mg - 8 tablets
        - High dose days. Expect high energy/insomnia.
[   ]  Day 3 - 30 mg - 6 tablets - First drop.
[   ]  Day 4 - 30 mg - 6 tablets - Maintain.
[   ]  Day 5 - 20 mg - 4 tablets - Halfway mark.
[   ]  Day 6 - 20 mg - 4 tablets - Maintain.
[   ]  Day 7 - 10 mg - 2 tablets - Rapid drop. 
       - Watch for body aches.
[   ]  Day 8 - 5 mg - 1 tablet - Final dose.
[   ]  Day 9 - 0 mg -STOP
